PARAGRAPH.STRING: , known around the world as "L.A." or by locals as the "City of Angels", is the most populous city in the state of California and the second-most in the United States. One of the world's major global cities,
is located in Southern California and

has a population of just over 4 million people, spanning 498 square miles. According to the U.S. Census Bureau, the Los Angeles metropolitan area has a total area of 4,850 square miles and is home to roughly 13 million people.
is also one of the world's most multicultural cities.
was not incorporated as a municipality until April 4, 1850--five months before California achieved statehood--and
is the county seat of Los Angeles County.
is one of the world's most important centers of culture, science, technology, international trade, and higher education, and
is home to numerous world-renowned institutions in a broad range of professional and cultural fields.
has a wide and diverse range of museums, theatres, and galleries. In addition,
is a leading producer of popular entertainment--such as motion pictures, television, and recorded music--which forms the base of
international fame and global status. In many circles,
is considered the leading center of American popular culture and
numerous media companies are a driving force in the Americanization of many countries in the Western world.
